page.title: 13Adisham Area Special Homes
page.content: There is a privately run Home for twenty three old people at Bossington. It caters for the local area and some residents are sponsored by the County Council. The inmates cover a wide variety of social classes who mix well. The Rector and Roman Catholic Priest from Aylesham visit the Home regularly. A visitor comes two days a week to help the residents with clay, art and craft work. There is a three monthly library delivery by the County and a range of papers and magazines provided. Just above Adisham village is a privately run home for nine mentally handicapped people who live in family with the owners. Some go out to work in local towns, while others remain at home. They attend Church and other village activities and are accepted in the community. Villagers are supportive of both Homes, visiting and helping.
